name: BRING THE HOUSE DOWN
description: First solo album by Skeats the guitar player/singer for Primmers and Penknife Glides

name: PLEASURE THRU TEARS
description:
Following on from their 2010 CD A Stab In The Dark, Penknife Glides complete the anthology with this latest release entitled Pleasure Thru Tears.

This 10 track CD encompasses some of their favourite songs written between 1981 and 1985 and now recently re-recorded by the band in New Zealand and Australia.

Apart from the familiar NZ tracks Pleasure Thru Tears and Sound of Drums, the majority of this new CD contain previously unreleased songs written during the latter part of their career in London and show a clear transition into a more electronic genre.

With the advent of digital recording still in its infancy in the early 1980s Penknife Glides worked closely with Tony Visconti's engineer in London honing their craft and demoing many of the tracks featured on this album.

Now 30 years later the band felt it was high time the rest of the world had an opportunity to savour some of these 1980s hidden gems.

name: A STAB IN THE DARK
description:
The new 30th anniversary limited edition CD from New Zealand band Penknife Glides. Featuring a splendid 6 min Dub version of the 'Taking the Weight Off' classic and a selection of their favourite, never before recorded songs from a 1980/81 set list.
Updated, re-recorded and mastered in Australia over the winter of 2009 this is a must have for fans and music lovers alike.
An additional CD sized booklet to accompany this disc is also available in store.

name: PENKNIFE GLIDES PRESS RELEASE PACK
description:
A 10 page CD size booklet which is designed as an accompaniment to the "A Stab In The Dark' CD (also available in store).
This stunning booklet provides a detailed and thoughtfully written insight into the bands early 80's musical career in Auckland just after the Punk phenomenon had disintegrated. Featuring plenty of early Penknife Glides photographs, this collectors item fills in the missing links while the band describe at length what inspired them to write the songs they did.
A must have for any coffee table so be quick as there is only a limited print run.

name: PRIMMERS
description:
It was early 1979 in the midst of the heady New Zealand punk explosion that the Primmers first unleashed their raw brand of no nonsense rock to an enthusiastic Auckland public. With their call to arms anthem ‘You’re Gonna Get Done’ hitting a raw nerve with diehard fans and subsequently being included on the now infamous AK79 compilation album of that year, the Primmers claimed their rightful place amongst a select number of underground New Zealand punk bands.

Now fast forward some 30 odd years and in 2012 the Primmers have compiled 11 of their best songs from that post punk era packaging them into this limited edition press release only debut CD entitled Durham Lane. Sourced from an archived selection of demo and live recordings, these never before released tracks offer a rare insight into the 1970’s Auckland punk scene giving the listener the opportunity to experience the Primmers at their vociferous best…..live
